name: CURIE
text: A [CURIE](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CURIE) defines a generic abbreviated syntax for expressing Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs). eg. `local-authority-eng:DAC`.

name: Datetime
text: A combination of a date and a time in the format `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.pppp]Z` as described in chapter 5.4 of [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601). The value can be truncated to just the most significant digits, for example "2014-05". Time values, where present, must be in UTC.

name: Decimal
text: A decimal value compatible with XML Schema xs:decimal type.

name: Flag
text: A value which is either `yes`, `no`, or blank.

name: WKT
text: A geometry encoded in the [OGC Well-known text (WKT)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Well-known_text_representation_of_geometry) format as defined by [ISO/IEC 13249-3:2016](https://www.iso.org/standard/60343.html) Coordinate values should be 6 or fewer decimal places, using the WGS84 or ETRS89 coordinate system.

name: Hash
text: A hash value serialised as a hexadecimal string. The default hash function is [SHA2-256](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-2). An alternative hash function may be supplied using a CURIE prefix, or the experimental [multihash](https://multiformats.io/multihash/) code.

name: Integer
text: An integer value compatible with XML Schema xs:integer type.

name: JSON
text: A blob of data encoded as a canonicalised JSON string compatible with [RFC 8259](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259).

name: Latitude
text: A latitude value which should be 6 or fewer decimal places, using the WGS84 or ETRS89 coordinate system.

name: Longitude
text: A longitude value which should be 6 or fewer decimal places, using the WGS84 or ETRS89 coordinate system.

name: Pattern
text: A regular expression pattern compatible with the [IEEE POSIX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/POSIX) Basic Regular Syntax (BRE).

name: String
text: A string of [Unicode 6.2.x](http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.2.0/) characters encoded as [UTF-8](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8).

name: Text
text: A string of text which may contain [Markdown](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown) formatting instructions.

name: URL
text: A [URL](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_locator) reference to another resource on the Web.
